refnamediv.refpurpose:
Git recursive directories scripts
Let monkey work to be done by monkies :) All gr-scipts support subdirectory hierarchy <my-dir>/<my-project-group>/<git-clone>.

para.screen: gr-authorcheck(1) ..... search for inappropriate commits gr-branches(1) ........ shows branches in subdirectories gr-clean(1) ........... cleans up git clones in subdirectories gr-commits2tag(1) ..... show commits from last tag divided to head,local,remote gr-gr(1) .............. general recussive script gr-initbare(1) ........ initialize git bare repo, makes first commit and tag 0.0.0 gr-pull(1) ............ pulls all and keeps local chanegs in subdirectories gr-pullreset(1) ....... pulls all and resets local changes in subdirectories gr-remotes(1) ......... shows remote branches in subdirectories gr-show(1) ............ shows local tags versus current remote situation in subdirectories gr-showlocal(1) ....... shows local tags and if it was edited in subdirectories gr-tags(1) ............ shows tags

refsect1.title: EXAMPLES
refsect1.para:
Current release contents:
gr-tags <PROJ_DIR> -v -ns -d 2 -c -hm "these changes are in last release:"
Next release contents:
gr-commits2tag <PROJ_DIR> -or -ns -mc 50 -hm "these changes will be in next release:"
